question: Can someone sue if they were misdiagnosed with HIV and then find out the the lab made a mistake?
question_content: Can someone sue if they were misdiagnosed with HIV and then find out the the lab made a mistake?

answers.answer_content:
I would think that you would just be so very thankful at NOT having the disease, that you would be satisfied with that.

And no, you can't sue....false positives to HIV tests have been happening for a long, long time. It is why the test is redone every 6 months.

Can you sue?  Probably.  Would you win your suit?  How exactly were you harmed?  Did you lose your home, your wife, your husband, your health or your job because of this?  Unless you can prove damages - and pain & suffering are not awarded - you won't win.  Labs sometimes  make mistakes. It's most unfortunate that this happened but you should examine your reasons for wanting to sue the lab.  What do you hope to gain?

In this country you can almost sue for anything. So the answer to your question is Yes.
But you have to give evidence that the misdiagnosis caused you complications which you would have not had if it had not happened and all  big institutions are always covered against lawsuits like that.

Ask a lawyer.

But if you are in America, the answer to "Can I sue for xxxxxx?", is almost always "Yes".

SHOULD you be able to sue is a totally different question. Ugh... don't get me started...
In todays world anyone can sue for anything.
